story.name: 6ce5e252-b79e-4f5c-b003-d1305c384b70
story.title: UK Attorney General may disclose his legal advice on parliament suspension
story.summary: BRITAIN-EU/COX (URGENT):UK Attorney General may disclose his legal advice on parliament suspension

xmlText.p: UK Attorney General may disclose his legal advice on parliament suspension

LONDON, England, Sept 25 (Reuters) - British Attorney General Geoffrey Cox said on Wednesday he would consider whether it was in the public interest to disclose more of the legal advice he gave relating to the decision to suspend parliament.

"I will consider over the coming days whether the public interest might require a greater disclosure of the advice given to the government on this subject," Cox told parliament, which resumed business on Wednesday after the supreme court ruled it had been unlawfully suspended. (Reporting by William James; editing by Stephen Addison)
